item.title: Tracey add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "The world was ending then, it's ending still, and I'm happy to belong to it again." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Jonathan Franzen
item.description: "I find it a huge strain to be responsible for my tastes and be known and defined by them." -- Jonathan Franzen

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Pirates could happen to anyone." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "We must be born with an intuition of mortality. Before we know the word for it. Before we know that there are words. Out we come, bloodied and squalling, with the knowledge that for all the points of the compass, there's only one direction. And time is its only measure." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Michel Foucault
item.description: "Do not ask who I am and do not ask me to remain the same. More than one person, doubtless like me, writes in order to have no face." -- Michel Foucault

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "All of old. Nothing else ever. Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Paul Bowles
item.description: "How many more times will you remember a certain afternoon of your childhood, some afternoon that's so deeply a part of your being that you can't even conceive of your life without it? Perhaps four or five times more. Perhaps not even that. How many more times will you watch the full moon rise? Perhaps twenty. And yet it all seems limitless." -- Paul Bowles

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Poetry is an abstraction bloodied." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "It ought to make us feel ashamed when we talk like we know what we're talking about when we talk about love." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "It's possible, in a poem or short story, to write about commonplace things and objects using commonplace but precise language, and to endow those things—a chair, a window curtain, a fork, a stone, a woman's earring—with immense, even startling power." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "Every great or even every very good writer makes the world over according to his own specifications." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one’s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Live to the point of tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Albert Camus wrote that the only serious question is whether to kill yourself or not. Tom Robbins wrote that the only serious question is whether time has a beginning and an end. Camus clearly got up on the wrong side of bed, and Robbins must have forgotten to set the alarm. There is only one serious question. And that is: Who knows how to make love stay? Answer me that and I will tell you whether or not to kill yourself." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The end is in the beginning and yet you go on." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Max Ehrmann
item.description:
"Desiderata" Go placidly amid the noise and the haste, and remember what peace there may be in silence. As far as possible, without surrender, be on good terms with all persons. Speak your truth quietly and clearly, and listen to others, even to the dull and ignorant; they too have their story. Avoid loud and aggressive persons; they are vexatious to the spirit. If you compare yourself with others, you may become vain or bitter, for always there will be greater and lesser persons than yourself. Enjoy your achievements as well as your plans. Keep interested in your own career however humble; it is a real possession in the changing fortunes of time. Exercise caution in your business affairs, for the world is full of trickery. But let this not blind you to what virtue there is; many persons strive for high ideals, and everywhere life is full of heroism. Be yourself. Especially do not feign affection. Neither be cynical about love, for in the face of all aridity and disenchantment, it is as perennial as the grass. Take kindly the counsel of the years, gracefully surrendering the things of youth. Nurture strength of spirit to shield you in sudden misfortune. But do not distress yourself with dark imaginings. Many fears are born of fatigue and loneliness.
Beyond a wholesome discipline, be gentle with yourself. You are a child of the universe no less than the trees and the stars; you have a right to be here. And whether or not it is clear to you, no doubt the universe is unfolding as it should. Therefore, be at peace with God, whatever you conceive Him to be. And whatever your labors and aspirations, in the noisy confusion of life, keep peace in your soul. With all its sham, drudgery, and broken dreams, it is still a beautiful world. Be cheerful. Strive to be happy." -- Max Ehrmann
